intro: Eriosema adamaouense, commonly known as the Adamou's eriosema, is a flowering plant native to West Africa. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, characterized by its pod fruits and nitrogen-fixing ability. The plant features trifoliate leaves with hairy surfaces, giving it a distinctive appearance. It produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Eriosema adamaouense is often found in savanna and woodland habitats, thriving in well-drained soils.
